text.body: I am disappointed on the timing but I understand. Thanks.

I am stuck in London. I will attend either in person or by video from our London office.
Haedicke
I am stuck in London -- hope to get out Sunday. Nice to hear from you.
I think it is something we watch closely as you suggest.

: It has been 120 days for voice mail that is not deleted. It should be further reduced to 7 days.
Haedicke
Is there anything I need to work on tonight? What is the schedule tonight?

and :
The Wholesale legal conference is coming up soon. I wanted to get a head count and the names of the attendees from each of you. For planning purposes, I have assumed 5 lawyers from each of your groups. Let me know. Also, are there any European or South American topics you would suggest we cover? So far, we have Whalley and Frevert signed up to give us a business update.
Regards,
I am fine with the agenda except that I will have E. Sager talk about the trading forms.
Thanks! Yes, please keep me off the Section 16 list!
That makes sense. How do we notify our trading counterparties?

: Thanks for raising that question because it is very important that we are coordinated. I have forwarded this question on to Jordan and I think he and I need to work together on this matter. Perhaps the three of us should get on the telephone to resolve.
Should we try Akin Gump? What is your recommendation off the list?
Coordination is a major problem at . You are asking all the right questions.
, I do not think I am going to nyc. Love Dad Haedicke
: The last sentence was changed to "we expect you to perform".
Thanks for the offer. I cannot use them either.
and I will cover the suggested topics.
[Haedicke, E.] J , please arrange for a meeting. It is ok for it to be lunch.

Thanks for inviting me. I unfortunately will not be able to attend.
Regards,
Haedicke

I have a few thoughts on the offsite. I think we could have a theme of restructuring and change. We would have to make sure it is forward looking and upbeat in that we have learned a lot that will make us better in the future. The presentations could include the following:
1. What we learned in CA -- Sager 2. Preparing for workouts -- Mellencamp 3. Lessons learned in international -- Lundstrom 4. Deregulation of energy markets -- Kean/Shapiro 5. Managing Legal Risks -- Haedicke 6. Executives -- Frevert and Whalley 7. Europe presentation 8. Retail presentation

:
Congratulations! We will need to talk about some additional coordination. Let me know when is convenient for you.
: I talked to and we have worked through a revised strategy as we talked about yesterday. So no call from .
: I want to put Aronowitz for ENA as well as EGM. He will get an assist from Sager but he will lead.

Please join me for a baseball game. The Astros are playing the NY Mets on Wednesday, August, 1. The game starts at 7:05 p.m.
Please RSVP to by e-mail to let her know if you will be able to attend. (Unfortunately due to the limited number of seats available in a suite, we were not able to extend this invitation to your spouse or significant other.)
to see you there!

Stacy:
I would like to know who on the committee is willing to spend time and resources on what issues. I think that is critical. Thanks.
Sami: Please set some time on my schedule tomorrow to talk this through.
It can wait his return. Please ask him if he is available to speak on Dec 4 at the conference.
We will get you a summary soon. Haedicke
: Taylor and I can get this done through Net Works. Thanks. Haedicke

: There is a conflict of interest in Thompson having all the info and selling to a group formed by him and other employees. We need to talk this through. Maybe, he should take a leave of absence. Should negotiate the deal for ENA? Selling to employees is sensitive now.

Thanks for the offer, but otherwise occupied.
Regards,
Just do the best you can. We will probably end up moving it to a different day.
Did we talk about the cap on breakage fee? Haedicke

Dear :
I am proud of MSU and would like to help. I will ask my assistant to set up a time for us to talk through your questions over the next week.
Regards,
Haedicke
Thanks for the message. I would e-mail Aronowitz. Regards,
Sami, by copy hereof, I have asked Hodge to look into this matter. He is at 36911.
I need to talk through our cash position for tomorrow at with our contingency team. I would like to do it today at 4:30 pm central time. Haedicke
J: Please forward this on to the employees that plan events. Shira is a family friend and I would recommend her. Also give me a status report.
, , : Do you have any comments on the agenda? Let me know and I will forward them on.
Where did we come out on a cap on breakage fee? Haedicke
I am ok so long as the firm would never pursue litigation against -- on that basis I would grant the waiver.

, thanks for the message. I think, I would like to plan a trip and discuss the issues in person at GE. Early October would work for me.
Regards,
Haedicke
I want to go through a list of each counterparty we think is going to go into bankruptcy and what we are doing to prepare for that. Thanks.
Good luck. I will email you later. Dad Haedicke
: Does the RTO order require a task force to draft new language? Let me know.
Yes, so long as they are employees and not on contract. Move them to Schuler's group.

Per our conversation yesterday, I propose we send out the following memo:
In order to better coordinate the various west coast power matters, effective immediately, Steffes and Sanders will jointly take the lead role. and will be responsible for preparing a comphrehensive strategy for all the matters, reviewing the strategy with the California Committee and seeking approval of the California Committee before taking any material action. Please do all you can to assist and on the west coast power matters.
I would copy only the people working on these matters including Steffes, Sanders, Belden, Mellencamp, Shapiro, Sharp, , Tribolet, Lavorato and Delainey.
: Can you look into this while is out of the office.
I will be on the telephone on this one because of a management meeting the same day.

:
This is a tough battle. It may be worse because your clients are either the same ones or geographically very close. I would try to address it by pointing out the limitations of the simplier forms and as a fallback emphasize the increased risk (legal and otherwise) when using the shorter forms.

:
is scheduled to speak on Friday, October 12 at 8:30 am for 30-45 minutes. No slides are necessary. The lawyers will be interested in where sees the growth in the company and where the business is strong. There will be Q&A and I think he will get some good questions. Some possible questions: What does expect from the legal department? How will the attacks impact on our business? What will be his focus in his new job? It should be a very friendly crowd -- since knows most of the lawyers and they know him.
I miss you too!
Haedicke
, in the Dunn Committee case, we just got a great order in our favor out of the courts. We need to try to leverage off this order to slow down the AG.
J, please get this message ready to send from me to the Specialists.

/:
Have we put the updated netting language in the contract? Would it ever come into play?
Regards,
There are some more developments re that we should talk about.
